member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile
member.summary: Use the PropertyObjectFile class to read and write PropertyObjects to disk. All TestStand files, including sequence files, type palette files, workspace files, configuration files, users file, and globals file, are stored as PropertyObjectFiles. Create new PropertyObjectFiles with the Engine.NewPropertyObjectFile method.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.Comment
member.summary: Specifies the comment string associated with the PropertyObjectFile object.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.Version
member.summary: Specifies the version string associated with the PropertyObjectFile object.
member.remarks: You can manually set this value to a valid version string where the numbers from left to right denote the Major, Minor, Revision, and Build version. The TestStand Engine increments the version number each time you save a modified sequence file if you enable the Auto Increment Sequence File Version option on the File tab of the Station Options dialog box. For files that are not sequence files, this property is not used.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.IncChangeCount
member.summary: Increments the file change count.
member.remarks: Increment the change count when making changes to the file to indicate to the sequence editor or user interface that the file was modified. Calling this method has the same effect as calling the SequenceFile.IncChangeCount method.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.ReadFile(NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeConflictHandlerTypes)
member.summary: Reads the contents of the file from disk.
member.remarks: The PropertyObjectFile.Path property determines the pathname of the file to read.
member.returns: Returns True if the file is read successfully. Returns False if the file has type conflicts and the user cancelled the operation.
member.param: Specifies how to handle type conflicts in the file.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.WriteFile(NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat)
member.summary: Writes the contents of the file to disk.
member.remarks: The PropertyObjectFile.Path property determines the pathname of the file to write.
member.param: Specifies the file format version TestStand uses to write the file.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.AsPropertyObject
member.summary: Returns the underlying PropertyObject that represents the PropertyObjectFile object. Use the PropertyObject to modify, add, or remove custom properties of the object.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.HandleTypeConflicts(NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeConflictHandlerTypes)
member.summary: Detects and resolves type conflicts that occur after loading a file.
member.remarks: Typically, the PropertyObjectFile.ReadFile method handles type conflicts. The engine loads the Engine.UsersFile, Engine.GlobalsFile and Engine.ConfigFile at startup, but does not resolve type conflicts in those files. Therefore, the sequence editor uses this method to resolve type conflicts in those files after it creates the Engine object.
member.returns: Returns True if types were resolved successfully.
member.param: Specifies how type conflicts are handled.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.ChangeCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of modifications that have been made to the file since it was loaded into memory.
member.remarks: The sequence editor and user interfaces use this count to determine when to refresh displays and when to indicate to the user that a file has been modified.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.Path
member.summary: Specifies the pathname of the file.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.DisplayName
member.summary: Specifies the name to display for the file.
member.remarks: This property returns the filename portion of the pathname value of the PropertyObjectFile.Path property unless you set it to a different value.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.Data
member.summary: Specifies the data object stored in the file.
member.remarks: This PropertyObject contains all the data in the file.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.ContentType
member.summary: Specifies the type of file content.
member.remarks: This property is set by the TestStand engine when creating and reading property object files. You should not change this property for predefined types of property object files, such as sequence files, workspace files, project files, type palette files, and the user file and globals file.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.FileTypeDescription
member.summary: Specifies a description of the type of file.
member.remarks: This string is localized for display in the local language. You cannot set this property for predefined types of files, such as sequence files.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.FileSection
member.summary: Specifies the section name written to the file.
member.remarks:
You generally do not need to use this property.
Note: You cannot set this property for predefined file types.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.OpenStatus
member.summary: Specifies the current status of the file, such as whether the file is open and displayed in a window.
member.returns: One of the values in FileOpenStatusFlags.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.EditPrivilege
member.summary: Specifies the privilege users must have to edit this file.
member.remarks: The sequence editor uses this property to determine whether the current user can edit the file.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.FileType
member.summary: Returns the type of file.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.IsDiskFileReadOnly
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the file on disk is read-only.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.TypeUsageList
member.summary: Returns the TypeUsageList associated with the file.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.IsModified
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the file has been modified since it was last written to disk.
member.remarks: This property returns True if the change count has increased since the last time the file was written to disk. After reading a file, TestStand might perform automatic type conversions and modify the file. For these files, this property returns True after the file is read from disk. The PropertyObjectFile.IsModifiedByUser property only returns True if the file is modified and TestStand did not perform all the modifications.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.SaveFileIfModified(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the contents of the file to disk if the file has been modified.
member.remarks:
This method does nothing if the file has not been modified. If the file has been modified, it prompts the user with an option to save, then writes the file. The PropertyObjectFile.Path property determines the pathname of the file to write.
Note: If you call this method multiple times and do not save the file or further modify it, the method prompts only once. Unlike the PropertyObjectFile.WriteFile method, if an error occurs while saving the file, the method displays the error and does not throw an exception.
member.returns: Returns False only if the user clicked Cancel in the Prompt dialog box.
member.param: If this parameter is True and if the file has been modified, a dialog box opens and asks the user whether to save the file.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.IsDiskFileModified
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the file on disk is newer or older than the one stored in memory.

para.para: * Returns 1 if the file on disk is newer than the one stored in memory.
* Returns -1 if the file on disk is older than the one stored in memory.
* Returns 0 if the file on disk has not changed.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.Id
member.summary:
Returns a unique ID number for the file.
Note: The ID number is never zero.
member.remarks: The ID number is unique with respect to all files you might open before you shut down the TestStand Engine. Use this ID number to compare two PropertyObjectFile object references to determine whether they refer to the same underlying file.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.CheckForModifiedTypes(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeVersionAutoIncrement,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Determines if the PropTypeFlags_IsModifiedType flag is set for any types used within the file.
member.remarks: If a modified type is found, the options parameter determines the specific action to take. If you pass CheckForModifiedTypes_Prompt to the options parameter, this method launches a warning dialog box in which you can specify the action, if any, that TestStand takes. The sequence editor calls this method before calling the PropertyObjectFile.WriteFile method to save a sequence file.
member.param: Specifies the title of the dialog box. Pass an empty string to use the default title for the dialog box.
Pass a string to display text on the OK button or pass an empty string to use the default text.

Specifies whether the method launches a warning dialog box if a modified type is found, or whether the method performs a specific action if a modified type is found. Pass one of CheckForModifiedTypesOptions constants to this method.
Specifies which version number to increment when you pass CheckForModifiedTypes_AutoIncrementVersions to the options parameter.
Returns True if a user clicks Cancel.
Returns True if modified types were found in the file.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.IsModifiedByUser
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the user has modified the file since it was last written to disk.
member.remarks: After reading a file, TestStand might perform automatic type conversions and modify the file. For these files, the PropertyObjectFile.IsModified property returns True after the file is read from disk. This property only returns True if the file is modified and TestStand did not perform all the modifications.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.Requirements
member.summary: Returns the Requirements property for the file. The Links subproperty of the Requirements property is an array of string values that represents the product and unit requirements that the file covers.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.Protection
member.summary: Specifies the protection level applied to a locked file in the sequence editor or applications that use the TestStand User Interface (UI) Controls.
member.remarks:
Setting this property on a locked file causes an error. Set this property when files are unlocked. This property applies only to sequence files. Setting this property on other files causes an error.
Note: TestStand supports password protecting sequence files to discourage editing and viewing within the sequence editor and user interfaces that use the TestStand UI Controls. The TestStand API limits access to a file protected from viewing but cannot prevent access to the file content during execution. National Instruments does not recommend using passwords as the only way of protecting intellectual property.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.Locked
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the file is locked.
member.remarks: This property returns True if file protection is enabled and the PropertyObjectFile.Lock method was called. After reading a protected file, TestStand automatically locks the file.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.Lock(System.Object)
member.summary: Locks the file. The PropertyObjectFile.Protection property specifies the type of protection for the lock. After reading a protected file, TestStand automatically locks the file. Use the PropertyObjectFile.Unlock method to unlock the file.
member.remarks:
This method applies only to sequence files. Using this method on other files causes an error. Locking a file causes an error when the PropertyObjectFile.Protection property is set to ProtectedObjectOption_None.
Note: TestStand supports password protecting sequence files to discourage editing and viewing within the sequence editor and user interfaces that use the TestStand User Interface (UI) Controls. The TestStand API limits access to a file protected from viewing but cannot prevent access to the file content during execution. National Instruments does not recommend using passwords as the only way of protecting intellectual property.
member.param: Specifies the password for the lock operation. If no passwordString parameter is specified, the previous password is used. If no previous password was specified, the password is an empty string.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.Unlock(System.String)
member.summary: Unlocks the file. The PropertyObjectFile.Protection property specifies the type of protection for the lock. Use the PropertyObjectFile.Lock method to lock the file.
member.remarks:
This method applies only to sequence files. Using this method on other files causes an error.
Note: TestStand supports password protecting sequence files to discourage editing and viewing within the sequence editor and user interfaces that use the TestStand User Interface (UI) Controls. The TestStand API limits access to a file protected from viewing but cannot prevent access to the file content during execution. National Instruments does not recommend using passwords as the only way of protecting intellectual property.
member.param: Specifies the password for the unlock operation.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.FileWritingFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format in which TestStand writes the file.
member.remarks: Attempting to set to INI (or any other unsupported value) will throw an exception.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjectFile.LastSavedChangeCount
member.summary: Returns the value of the PropertyObjectFile.ChangeCount property at the time the file was last saved. Setting the value of the PropertyObjectFile.ChangeCount property equal to the value of the PropertyObjectFile.LastSavedChangeCount property causes the PropertyObjectFile.IsModified property to return False.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeConflictHandlerTypes
member.summary: These constants specify how TestStand responds when encountering two conflicting definitions for the same type. Type conflicts generally occur when TestStand reads a type from a sequence file that has a different structure than the type already loaded.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeConflictHandlerTypes.ConflictHandler_Error
member.summary: (Value: 1) Specifies that the method returns an error if type conflicts exist.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeConflictHandlerTypes.ConflictHandler_Prompt
member.summary: (Value: 3) Specifies that the method prompts the user with a dialog box to resolve each type conflict.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeConflictHandlerTypes.ConflictHandler_UseGlobalType
member.summary: (Value: 4) Specifies that the method converts the conflicting type to the currently loaded (global) type if a type conflict exists.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module
member.summary: Use objects from the module class to specify and obtain information about code modules that steps or step type substeps execute. Typically, you use this class only when you write a sequence editor. To obtain a Module object, use the Step.Module property. To access the properties and methods of an adapter-specific module class, query the Module object for the interface of the adapter-specific module interface you want.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.AsPropertyObject
member.summary: Returns the underlying PropertyObject that represents the Module object.
member.remarks: Use the PropertyObject to modify, add, or remove custom properties of the object.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.Adapter
member.summary: Returns the Adapter object that this module uses.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.Step
member.summary: Returns a reference to the step in which the module resides.
member.remarks: Steps share their modules between the original steps and the run-time copies of the steps, so this property always returns an original step and never a run-time copy of the step.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.Load(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Loads the underlying code module.
member.returns: Returns True on success or False if the module fails to load.
member.param: Specifies one or more LoadModuleOptions using the bitwise-OR operator to modify the behavior of this method.

If you pass LoadModule_EvaluateExpressions to the loadOptions parameter, pass a SequenceContext object for this parameter to use when evaluating expressions. If you call this method from a step in an execution, pass the sequence context of the execution.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.Unload
member.summary: Unloads the underlying code module.
member.remarks: The module is not unloaded if it is currently executing.
member.returns: Indicates if the module was successfully unloaded.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.CanSpecify
member.summary: Indicates if the adapter for the module supports the Module.Specify method. Use the Step.CanSpecifyModule property to determine whether a step supports specifying a module.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.Specify(System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens the Specify Module dialog box for the step, if one exists.
member.remarks:
Use the Module.CanSpecify property to verify that you can call this method. The current version of TestStand does not support all SpecifyModuleOptions constants for all adapters, as the following list indicates:
* LabVIEW Adapter—Only supports SpecMod_ReadOnly.
* LabWindows/CVI Adapter—Supports all options.
* C/C++ DLL Adapter—Supports all options.
* .NET—Only supports SpecMod_ReadOnly.
* ActiveX/COM Adapter—Only supports SpecMod_ReadOnly.
* HTBasic Adapter—Only supports SpecMod_ReadOnly.
* Sequence Adapter—Supports all options.
member.returns: Returns True if the Specify Module dialog box modifies the module.
member.param: Specifies one or more SpecifyModuleOptions constants to modify the behavior of the Specify Module dialog box.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.CanCreateCode
member.summary: Indicates if the adapter for the module supports the Module.CreateCode method. Use the Step.CanCreateCode property to determine whether a step can create code for the module of the step.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.CreateCode
member.summary: Creates code for the module.
member.remarks:
The contents of the code depend on the adapter used to create the module, the settings for the module, and the code templates configured for the step type of the step that contains the module. Use the Module.CanCreateCode property to determine whether this step can create code with this method. For adapters that use Microsoft Visual Studio, calling this method can result in prompts to the user if any of the following conditions exist:
* Multiple versions of Visual Studio exist on the computer and you select the Always Prompt for Version option from the Version of Visual Studio to Use for Create and Edit Code ring control in the Adapter Configuration dialog box.
* Multiple versions of Visual Studio exist on the computer and you select the Use the Version that Matches the Project File option from the Version of Visual Studio to Use for Create and Edit Code ring control in the Adapter Configuration dialog box, and TestStand cannot match the version of the file.
* A method already exists with the same name.
* The specified solution does not contain the specified project.
* The specified project does not contain the specified source file.
Note: The ActiveX/COM, Sequence, and HTBasic Adapters do not support this method. For DotNetModule objects, use the DotNetCall.CreateCode method instead of this method.
member.returns: Indicates whether the module was modified.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.CanEditCode
member.summary: Indicates if the adapter for the module supports the Module.EditCode method. Use the Step.CanEditCode property to determine whether a step can edit code for the module of the step.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.EditCode
member.summary: Launches an external application in which you can edit the code associated with the module.
member.remarks:
Launches the application associated with the adapter. For example, modules created with the LabVIEW Adapter launch LabVIEW. For adapters that use Microsoft Visual Studio, calling this method can result in prompts to the user if any of the following conditions exist:
* Multiple versions of Visual Studio exist on the computer and you select the Always Prompt for Version option from the Version of Visual Studio to Use for Create and Edit Code ring control in the Adapter Configuration dialog box.
* Multiple versions of Visual Studio exist on the computer and you select the Use the Version that Matches the Project File option from the Version of Visual Studio to Use for Create and Edit Code ring control in the Adapter Configuration dialog box, and TestStand cannot match the version of the file.
* The specified solution does not contain the specified project.
* The specified project does not contain the specified source file.
member.returns: Indicates if the module was modified.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.GetDescription(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a description string for the module.
member.remarks: This string can change whenever you modify any of the module settings.
member.param: Specifies one or more StepDescriptionOptions constants. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify multiple sequence file flags.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.UnmappedArgumentValues
member.summary: Returns the UnmappedArgumentValues collection, which contains a list of the arguments not used as inputs and outputs of the corresponding module.
member.remarks:
When a module prototype changes, TestStand attempts to map the current module arguments to the new prototype by looking for matching argument names and data types, and by matching argument positions and data types. If TestStand fails to assign an argument to the new prototype, the argument is added to this collection.
TestStand does not clear the collection when you load a new prototype. Use UnmappedArgumentValues.Clear method to clear the collection before calling Module.LoadPrototype. For DotNetModule objects, use the DotNetCall.UnmappedArgumentValues property instead of this property.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.IsPrototypeIncompatible
member.summary: Indicates whether the module prototype is incompatible with the actual prototype of the external module.
member.remarks: TestStand can read prototype information from some external modules, such as DLLs, LabVIEW VIs, or ActiveX COM type libraries. This property returns True if TestStand successfully reads prototype information from the external module and the module prototype does not match the prototype the external module specifies.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.ClearUnmappedArgumentValues

summary.para: Note: This method is obsolete. Use the UnmappedArgumentValues.ClearUnmappedArgumentValues.Clear method instead.

member.remarks: Removes the items in the UnmappedArgumentValues collection. Clear the items if you do not want them available for the next prototype change.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.LoadPrototype(System.Int32)
member.summary: Loads the prototype for the module and sets the module parameters to match the prototype.
member.remarks:
This method replaces the following obsolete methods: CommonCModule.LoadPrototype LabVIEWModule.LoadPrototype ActiveXModule.LoadMemberInfo SequenceCallModule.LoadParameters Depending on the type of module, calling this method loads a LabVIEW VI, a sequence file, a DLL, or an ActiveX Automation server to determine the module prototype.
Note: The .NET Adapter does not support this call and returns without taking any action. Use the DotNetCall.LoadPrototypeFromSignature method instead.
member.returns: Returns a value that indicates whether the step was modified.
member.param: Specifies one or more LoadPrototypeOptions constants. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify multiple flags.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.Module.GetLastLoadWarnings
member.summary: Returns an array of warnings that resulted from the last time you called the Module.Load method in an attempt to load the module.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.HTBasicStepAdditions
member.summary: Note: Do not use the following constants to access the adapter-specific properties of a step. Use the HTBasicModule interface for the Module object for the step. member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommandOptions
member.summary: These constants represent the options you can use with the options parameter of the WorkspaceObject.DoSourceControlCommand, WorkspaceObject.CanDoSourceControlCommand, and WorkspaceObject.UpdateStatus methods. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify more than one option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommandOptions.SCCmdOption_DoNotRecurse
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) Does not apply the operation recursively on items in the container.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommandOptions.SCCmdOption_SkipPromptDialog
member.summary:
(Value: 0x2) Does not launch a dialog box with a list of files before performing the operation on the files. You cannot combine this option with SCCmdOption_ShowPromptDialog. If you do not specify this option or SCCmdOption_ShowPromptDialog, the engine Configuration option determines whether the dialog box is launched.
Note: This constant applies only to the SCCmd_CheckOut and SSCmd_GetLatest commands for the WorkspaceObject.DoSourceControlCommand method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommandOptions.SCCmdOption_ShowPromptDialog
member.summary:
(Value: 0x4) Launches a dialog box with a list of files before performing the operation on the files. You cannot combine this option with SCCmdOption_SkipPromptDialog. If you do not specify this option or SCCmdOption_SkipPromptDialog, the engine Configuration option determines whether the dialog box is launched.
Note: This constant applies only to the SCCmd_CheckOut and SSCmd_GetLatest commands for the WorkspaceObject.DoSourceControlCommand method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommandOptions.SCCmdOption_SkipErrorDialog
member.summary: (Value: 0x8) Does not launch a dialog box for errors.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommandOptions.SCCmdOption_NoOptions
member.summary: (Value: 0x0) No options.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ReleaseSeqFileOptions
member.summary: These constants represent the options you can use with the options parameter of the Engine.ReleaseSequenceFileEx method. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify more than one option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ReleaseSeqFileOptions.ReleaseSeqFile_DoNotRunUnloadCallback
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) Use this option to prevent the SequenceFileUnload callback sequence from running if the callback exists and the reference being released is the last reference. If other references exist to the sequence file, TestStand might execute the SequenceFileUnload callback when these references are released using the Engine.ReleaseSequenceFileEx method. Regardless of whether you use this option, TestStand does not execute the SequenceFileUnload callback if the SequenceFileLoad callback was not executed because all references to the sequence file were obtained by passing the GetSeqFile_DoNotRunLoadCallback option to the Engine.GetSequenceFileEx method. Use the SequenceFile.UnloadCallbackEnabled property to prevent the SequenceFileUnload callback from ever being executed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ReleaseSeqFileOptions.ReleaseSeqFile_NoOptions
member.summary: (Value: 0x0) No options.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ReleaseSeqFileOptions.ReleaseSeqFile_UnloadFileIfModified
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) Use this option to remove a modified sequence file from the internal cache of the engine. If TestStand cannot remove a modified sequence file from the cache, the Engine.ReleaseSequenceFileEx method generates an error. If your development environment requires you to explicitly release COM references, do not release the COM reference to a SequenceFile object until a call to the Engine.ReleaseSequenceFileEx method succeeds.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ReleaseSeqFileOptions.ReleaseSeqFile_UnloadFile
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) Use this option to request TestStand to remove a sequence file from the internal cache of the engine. When you specify this option, it does not guarantee that TestStand removes the sequence file from the cache because there might be multiple references to it or it might be executing. If TestStand cannot remove a sequence file from the cache, the Engine.ReleaseSequenceFileEx method generates an error. If your development environment requires you to explicitly release COM references, do not release the COM reference to a SequenceFile object until a call to the Engine.ReleaseSequenceFileEx method succeeds. If you do not specify this option, TestStand might remove the sequence file from the cache if TestStand no longer needs the file.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.FileOpenStatusFlags
member.summary: Use these constants to specify the PropertyObjectFile.OpenStatus property. Generally, only user interfaces need to set this property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.FileOpenStatusFlags.OpenStatus_InWindow
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) Specifies that the file is open and displayed in a window.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyDialogOptions
member.summary: These constants represent the options you can use with the dlgOptions parameter of the PropertyObject.DisplayPropertiesDialog method. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify more than one option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyDialogOptions.PropDlgOption_DisableAdvancedButton
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) Disables the Advanced button in the dialog box to prevent the user from editing the flag settings for the property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyDialogOptions.PropDlgOption_DisableNumericFormatButton
member.summary: (Value: 0x8) Disables the Numeric Format button in the dialog box to prevent the user from changing the format of the property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyDialogOptions.PropDlgOption_ModalToAppMainWind
member.summary: (Value: 0x10000) By default, the dialog box is modal to the last active window of the calling thread, or if none exists, to the last active window from AppMainHwnd. If you set this option, the dialog box is modal with respect to the window handle of the Engine.AppMainHwnd property. Typically, you do not need to set this option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyDialogOptions.PropDlgOption_ReadOnly
member.summary: (Value: 0x20000) Use this option to create a read-only version of the dialog box.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyDialogOptions.PropDlgOption_ShowViewContentsButton
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) Adds a View Contents button to the bottom of the dialog box. Click the View Contents button to close the dialog box and include the PropDlgOutput_ViewContents flag in the return value of the method that displays the dialog box. The caller of the method that launches the dialog box responds to the View Contents button by displaying the object to which the dialog box applies in the user interface.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyDialogOptions.PropDlgOption_NoOptions
member.summary: (Value: 0x0) No option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyDialogOptions.PropDlgOption_UseVariablesViewDialog
member.summary: (Value: 0x10) Display the version of the dialog used by the TestStand Sequence Editor Variables View. Currently applies only to DisplayFlagsDialog.

member.summary: These constants represent the return values of the PropertyObject.DisplayPropertiesDialog method. Use the bitwise-AND operator with the return value to determine whether any of these flags are set.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyDialogOutputs.PropDlgOutput_AppliedToAllInstances
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) For types, indicates that the user selected the Apply Value to All Loaded Instances of the Type option and that all instances were updated.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyDialogOutputs.PropDlgOutput_AppliedChanges

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList
member.summary:
The TypeUsageList contains a list of types a PropertyObjectFile object uses. Use this class to insert or delete types from a file.
Note: When you edit a PropertyObjectFile object by inserting named data types or step types in to the file, add any new types to the TypeUsageList object for the file so the types immediately appear in the Types view in the sequence editor for the file. Use the TypeUsageList.AddUsedTypes or TypeUsageList.Union method to add new types.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList.Union(NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList)
member.summary: Adds all the types from one type usage list to another.
member.remarks: Does not add types that already exist in both type usage lists.
member.returns: Returns True if any types were added. Otherwise, returns False.
member.param: Specifies the type usage list that contains the types to add.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList.NumTypes
member.summary: Returns the number of types in the type usage list.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList.GetTypeDefinition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the type the index parameter specifies.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the type in the type usage list.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList.GetTypeIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the index of the type the typeNameParam parameter specifies.
member.returns: The index of the type with the specified name. Returns -1 if no type in the list has the specified name.
member.param: Specifies the type name to locate in the list.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList.InsertType(NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObject,System.Int32,NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeCategories)
member.summary: Inserts a type into the type usage list and associates it with a type category.
member.param: Specifies the new type definition to insert.
Specifies the zero-based index at which to insert the type into the type usage list.
Specifies the type category to associate with the type.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList.RemoveType(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the type the index parameter specifies from the type usage list.
member.returns: The removed type.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the type to remove.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList.GetIsTypeAttachedToFile(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the type the index parameter specifies is attached to the file that contains the type usage list.
member.remarks: Types that are attached to a file are saved with the file to which the list belongs, even if no instances of the type exist in the file.
member.returns: Returns True if the type is attached to the file.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the type in the type usage list.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList.AddUsedTypes(NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObject)
member.summary: Adds all the types the specified object uses to the type usage list.
member.returns: Returns True if any types were added to the type usage list.
member.param: Specifies the object from which to add types to the type usage list.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList.ChangeCount
member.summary: Returns the number of modifications made to the type usage list.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList.SetIsTypeAttachedToFile(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies if the type the index parameter specifies is attached to the file that contains the type usage list.
member.remarks: Types attached to a file are saved with the file to which the list belongs, even if no instances of the type exist in the file.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the type in the type usage list.
Pass True to attach the type to the file.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList.MoveType(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the type the index parameter specifies to a new index in the type usage list.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the type to move.
Specifies the new zero-based index of the type.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList.ValidateNewTypeName(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Determines if the specified name is valid for a new type definition.
member.remarks: Call this method before adding a new type definition to a type usage list to determine whether the name of the new type definition is valid.
member.returns: Returns a description of why the name is not valid.
member.param: Specifies the new name to validate.
In addition to validating the name, also check if the name is already in use. If this parameter is False, the method reports that the new name is invalid if it is already in use.
Returns True if the new name is valid.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeUsageList.CreateAndInsertNewTypeFromExisting(NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObject,System.Int32,NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeCategories,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new type with a unique name based on the type you specify in the existingType parameter and inserts and attaches the new type to the type usage list. This method also clears some type-specific settings in the newly created type, such as the flags PropFlags_NotDeletable, PropFlags_NotEditable, and PropFlags_NameNotEditable; the type flags PropTypeFlags_NIInstalledType and PropTypeFlags_PreventEditingType; the TypeMinimumTestStandVersion; and the password protection settings. Using this method is equivalent to copying and pasting a type in the Types window in the TestStand Sequence Editor to create a new type based on an existing type.
member.returns: Returns the newly created type, which is already inserted into and attached to the type usage list.
member.param: Specifies the existing root type definition on which to base the newly created type.
Specifies the index in the type usage list at which to insert the new type.
Specifies the type category in which to insert the new type.
Reserved for future use. Pass 0 for this parameter.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject
member.summary: Objects of the WorkspaceObject class represent nodes for workspace and project files on the Workspace pane. Workspace objects handle all source code control operations on files.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.NewFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a WorkspaceObject folder.
member.remarks: Use the WorkspaceObject.InsertObject method to insert the object into the workspace.
member.param: Specifies the name of the folder.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.NewFile(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new WorkspaceObject associated with the specified pathname.
member.remarks: Use the WorkspaceObject.InsertObject method to insert the object into the workspace. This method uses the file extension to determine the type of WorkspaceObject.
member.param: Specifies the pathname associated with the WorkspaceObject. This pathname can be relative.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.InsertObject(NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a WorkspaceObject at the specified index under another WorkspaceObject.
member.remarks: Use the WorkspaceObject.NewFile or WorkspaceObject.NewFolder method to create a new WorkspaceObject.
member.param: Specifies the WorkspaceObject to be insert.
Specifies the zero-based index specifying the location at which to insert the WorkspaceObject.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.Path
member.summary: Returns the pathname associated with the WorkspaceObject.
member.remarks: Folder objects do not contain a pathname. The pathname can be relative.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.DisplayName
member.summary: Specifies the display name for this WorkspaceObject.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.IsCodeModule

member.summary: Specifies the pathname of the sequence file to which this code module belongs.
member.remarks: This property associates a WorkspaceObject with a particular sequence file. Code modules that are stored in the workspace use the property to determine to which sequence file they belong.
member.returns: The pathname of the sequence file. This pathname can be relative.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.ObjectType
member.summary: Returns the WorkspaceObject type.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.SourceControlStatus
member.summary: Returns the current source code control status of this WorkspaceObject.
member.returns: One of the values in SourceControlStatuses.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.DoSourceControlCommand(NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommands,System.Boolean@,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Performs the specified source code control command on the specified files.
member.remarks: Call the WorkspaceObject.CanDoSourceControlCommand method before calling this method.
member.returns: Returns True if the command was completed successfully for all specified files.
member.param: Specifies the source code control command to perform.
Returns True if the command modified the workspace file.
Specifies one or more of the SourceControlCommandOptions constants.
Specifies an array of WorkspaceObjects that specifies the selected files. If you omit this argument, the method uses the file associated with this WorkspaceObject.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.AsPropertyObject
member.summary: Returns the underlying PropertyObject that represents the WorkspaceObject object. Use the PropertyObject to modify, add, or remove custom properties of the object.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.GetAbsolutePath
member.summary: Returns the absolute pathname of the file associated with this WorkspaceObject.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.RemoveObject(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the WorkspaceObject at the specified index.
member.returns: Returns the removed object.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the object to remove.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.ProjectFile
member.summary: Returns the project file to which this object belongs.
member.remarks: All WorkspaceObjects belong to a single project file in the workspace.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.InsertCodeModules(System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts WorkspaceObjects for the code modules of the specified sequence files.
member.remarks:
This method traverses the WorkspaceObject hierarchy searching for sequence files. For each sequence file it finds, this method finds all the code modules in the sequence file and adds a WorkspaceObject for each one to the workspace.
Note: Code modules are a static representation of the current WorkspaceObject hierarchy. If you change the hierarchy or any elements in the hierarchy, you must delete the code module WorkspaceObjects and call this method again.
member.returns: Returns an array of WorkspaceObjects that were added to the workspace.
member.param: Specifies an array of WorkspaceObjects that specifies the selected files. If you omit this argument, the method uses this WorkspaceObject.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.UpdateStatus(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the source code control status of the specified WorkspaceObjects.
member.param: Pass SCCmdOption_DoNotRecurse to specify only this WorkspaceObject. Otherwise, this method updates the status of all contained objects as well.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.FileExists
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the file associated with the WorkspaceObject exists.
member.remarks: This method is valid only on WorkspaceObjects that contain a pathname.

member.remarks: Call this function to determine whether you can call the WorkspaceObject.DoSourceControlCommand method on the selected files.

member.param: Specifies the command to check.

Specifies an array of WorkspaceObjects that specifies the selected files. If you omit this argument, the method uses the file associated with this WorkspaceObject.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObject.NumContainedObjects
