member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.UsersFile
member.summary: The UsersFile class represents the file that contains a list of TestStand users and user profiles. Use this class to add or delete users and user profiles. You can obtain a reference to the users file TestStand loads at startup with the Engine.UsersFile property. To perform read or write operations for objects from the UsersFile class, obtain a reference to the PropertyObjectFile interface by using the AsPropertyObjectFile methods, then use the PropertyObjectFile.ReadFile and PropertyObjectFile.WriteFile methods.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.UsersFile.UserList
member.summary: Specifies the array of users.
member.remarks: Use the methods of the PropertyObject class to add or remove users from this object to change the TestStand user list, and to access the subproperties of each element in the array of User objects. Refer to User Data Type Subproperties for the default subproperties that TestStand defines.
member.returns: Returns a property object that is an array of User objects.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.UsersFile.UserProfileList
member.summary:
Specifies the array of user profiles.
Note: This property is obsolete. Use UserGroupList instead.
member.remarks: Use the methods of the PropertyObject class to add or remove user profiles from this object to change the TestStand user list, and to access the subproperties of each element in the array of User objects.
member.returns: Returns a property object that is an array of User objects.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.UsersFile.ReloadFromDisk
member.summary: Reloads the users file from disk.

remarks.para: Note: After reloading the user file, any references to the UsersFile.UserList property and other users will be out of date.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.UsersFile.AsPropertyObjectFile
member.summary: Returns the underlying PropertyObjectFile that represents the UsersFile object.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.UsersFile.UserGroupList
member.summary: Specifies the array of User objects.
member.remarks: Use the methods of the PropertyObject class to add or remove user groups from this object to change the TestStand user group list, and to access the subproperties of each element in the array of group objects. Use the User.Members property to edit the user names that are members of the group. Refer to User Data Type Subproperties for the default subproperties TestStand defines.
member.returns: Returns a property object that is an array of User objects.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EvaluationOptions
member.summary: These constants represent the options you can use with the evaluationOptions parameter of the PropertyObject.EvaluateEx, Expression.Evaluate, Expression.Validate, ExpressionEdit.Evaluate, and Engine.CheckExpression methods. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify more than one option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EvaluationOptions.EvalOption_AllowEmptyExpression
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) Use this option to prevent TestStand from treating empty expressions as syntax errors.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EvaluationOptions.EvalOption_NoOptions
member.summary: (Value: 0x0) No options.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EvaluationOptions.EvalOption_DoNotAlterValues
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) Use this option to prevent TestStand from altering the value of any variable or property the expression contains. The Expression.Validate and Engine.CheckExpression methods do not use this value because these methods never alter values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EvaluationOptions.EvalOption_AllowIndexingEmptyArrays
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) Use this option to direct TestStand to return a value with a type that is the array element type for empty arrays with subscripts. If you do not specify this option, TestStand treats an empty array with subscripts as an error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EvaluationOptions.EvalOption_CreateNonExistentVariables
member.summary: (Value: 0x8) Use this option to have TestStand create temporary objects for variables that do not exist in an expression. This option is useful when evaluating an expression for error checking if the expression might contain dynamically created variables.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EvaluationOptions.EvalOption_ForErrorChecking
member.summary: (Value: 0x10) Use this option to direct TestStand to evaluate the expression in order to check the expression for errors. This option makes errors reported at edit time more closely match errors that might occur at run time. For example, when using this option, expressions do not use short-circuit evaluation, ensuring that TestStand checks the entire expression for errors. This option also enables the behavior of the #NoValidation directive. Expression validation methods, such as Engine.CheckExpression and Expression.ValidateEvaluationType, automatically include this option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EvaluationOptions.EvalOption_IgnoreNoValidationDirective
member.summary: (Value: 0x20) This option disables the behavior of the #NoValidation directive when checking an expression for errors. Use this option to find errors the #NoValidation directive normally suppresses.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeCategories
member.summary: The following constants represent the categories to which a type can belong:

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeCategories.TypeCategory_None
member.summary: (Value: 0) Specifies no data type.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeCategories.TypeCategory_StepTypes
member.summary: (Value: 1) Specifies a step type.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeCategories.TypeCategory_CustomDataTypes
member.summary: (Value: 2) Specifies a custom data type.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TypeCategories.TypeCategory_BuiltinDataTypes
member.summary: (Value: 3) Specifies a built-in data type.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObjectTypes
member.summary: This data type contains values that specify the type of a workspace object. Use the values of this enumeration with the WorkspaceObject.ObjectType property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObjectTypes.WorkspaceObjType_WorkspaceFile
member.summary: (Value: 1) Specifies a workspace file object.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObjectTypes.WorkspaceObjType_ProjectFile
member.summary: (Value: 2) Specifies a project file object.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObjectTypes.WorkspaceObjType_Folder
member.summary: (Value: 3) Specifies a folder object. Folders do not have a pathname associated with them.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObjectTypes.WorkspaceObjType_SequenceFile
member.summary: (Value: 4) Specifies a sequence file object.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WorkspaceObjectTypes.WorkspaceObjType_OtherFile
member.summary: (Value: 5) Specifies a file other than a sequence file, workspace file, or project file, such as a code module. This type of object cannot contain other objects.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommands
member.summary: This data type contains values that specify source code control commands. Use one of these values to specify the scCommand parameter of the WorkspaceObject.DoSourceControlCommand and WorkspaceObject.CanDoSourceControlCommand methods.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommands.SCCmd_AddToSC
member.summary: (Value: 1) Adds the specified files to source code control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommands.SCCmd_RemoveFromSC
member.summary: (Value: 2) Removes the specified files from source code control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommands.SCCmd_CheckOut
member.summary: (Value: 3) Checks out the specified files from source code control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommands.SCCmd_CheckIn
member.summary: (Value: 4) Checks in the specified files to source code control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommands.SCCmd_GetLatest
member.summary: (Value: 5) Obtains the latest version of the specified files from source code control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommands.SCCmd_UndoCheckOut
member.summary: (Value: 6) Undoes the check out of the specified files from source code control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommands.SCCmd_ShowDifferences
member.summary: (Value: 7) Shows the differences between the latest version in source code control and the local version of the specified file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommands.SCCmd_ShowHistory
member.summary: (Value: 8) Shows the source code control history of the specified file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommands.SCCmd_ShowProperties
member.summary: (Value: 9) Shows the source code control properties of the specified file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlCommands.SCCmd_ShowProviderOptions
member.summary: (Value: 10) Launches the source code control provider options dialog box.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SequenceFileTypes
member.summary: This data type contains values that specify the type of a sequence file. The constants represent the possible values for the SequenceFile.SequenceFileType property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SequenceFileTypes.SeqFileType_Normal
member.summary: (Value: 0) A normal sequence file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SequenceFileTypes.SeqFileType_Model
member.summary: (Value: 1) A process model sequence file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SequenceFileTypes.SeqFileType_FrontEndCBacks
member.summary: (Value: 2) The sequence file containing Front-End callbacks.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SequenceFileTypes.SeqFileType_StationCBacks
member.summary: (Value: 3) The sequence file containing the Test Station callbacks.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SequenceFileTypes.SeqFileType_Template
member.summary: (Value: 4) The sequence file containing the templates for callback sequences.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjTypeFlags
member.summary: These constants represent the flags you can set and get on PropertyObject type definitions. Get and set type flags only on PropertyObject objects that are the root objects of type definitions. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify more than one flag for a particular PropertyObject object.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjTypeFlags.PropTypeFlags_NoFlags
member.summary: (Value: 0x0) No flags.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjTypeFlags.PropTypeFlags_NoAutoConvertVersions
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) If TestStand opens a file containing an already-loaded type and the versions of the type are not the same, it converts the older version to newer version without launching a Type Conflict dialog box or returning an error. If one or both versions of the type has PropTypeFlags_NoAutoConvertVersions set, TestStand does not perform this automatic type conversion.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjTypeFlags.PropTypeFlags_NIInstalledType
member.summary: (Value: 0x2000000) Indicates that the type is an installed TestStand type provided by National Instruments. Do not set this flag.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjTypeFlags.PropTypeFlags_IsModifiedType
member.summary: (Value: 0x4000000) TestStand sets this flag in a type definition object when the user edits the property sheet of the type definition object, adds properties to it, changes a property value, or performs any other action that modifies the type. TestStand does not automatically convert an older version of a type to a newer version if one of them has PropTypeFlags_IsModifiedType set. Instead, TestStand launches a Type Conflict In File dialog box or returns an error. Update the version of the modified type to clear this flag. You can also update and obtain this flag using the PropertyObject.IsModifiedType property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjTypeFlags.PropTypeFlags_DisableEditingInstanceFlags
member.summary: (Value: 0x10) Set this flag in a type definition to indicate that users are not allowed to change the property flags in instances of the type.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.PropertyObjTypeFlags.PropTypeFlags_PreventEditingType
member.summary:
(Value: 0x4) Specifies whether you can edit the type in the sequence editor.
Note: This option applies only to NI-installed types.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.RestartOptions
member.summary: These constants represent the options you can use with the options parameter of the Execution.RestartEx method. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify more than one option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.RestartOptions.RestartOption_BreakOnEntry
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) Use this option to suspend execution before executing the first step.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.RestartOptions.RestartOption_OverrideNotRestartable
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) Use this option to restart an execution created with the ExecutionTypeMask.ExecTypeMask_NotRestartable option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.RestartOptions.RestartOption_NoOptions
member.summary: (Value: 0x0) No options.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.RestartOptions.RestartOption_BreakOnStepFailure
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) Specifies if the sequence editor and user interfaces suspend when a step fails. TestStand does not suspend an execution on a failing Sequence Call step if the step that caused the sequence failure already suspended execution.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.RestartOptions.RestartOption_BreakOnSequenceFailure
member.summary: (Value: 0x8) Specifies if the sequence editor and user interfaces suspend when a failing step causes a sequence failure to first occur. TestStand does not suspend on failing Sequence Call steps already in the stack. If the sequence failure setting is reset, TestStand suspends when the next failing step causes sequence failure.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ResetTypeInstanceOptions
member.summary:
These constants represent the options you can use with the options parameter of the Engine.ResetTypeInstances method. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify more than one option.
Note: Avoid using the ResetTypeInst_ResetFlags flag because it might result in unexpected behavior. In most cases, you should not reset certain flags on type instances. For example, the PropFlags_PassByReference flag is set on parameters of Sequence Call steps. Calling the Engine.ResetTypeInstances method on a type can change whether TestStand passes a sequence parameter that is an instance of the type by reference.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ResetTypeInstanceOptions.ResetTypeInst_NoOptions
member.summary: (Value: 0x0) No options.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ResetTypeInstanceOptions.ResetTypeInst_ResetValues
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) Resets the property values of type instances to the value of the type definition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ResetTypeInstanceOptions.ResetTypeInst_ResetFlags
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) Resets the property flags of type instances to the flags of the type definition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ResetTypeInstanceOptions.ResetTypeInst_RecurseSubProperties
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) Resets flags or values of subproperties of type instances in addition to the top level object.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat
member.summary:
These constants specify the file format version TestStand uses to write a file. If you save a sequence file in a previous format and the file contains step types not present in the previous version of TestStand or if the file uses features the previous version of TestStand does not support, the sequence file you save will not function correctly.
Note: TestStand does not warn you if the file you save cannot load or run in a previous version of TestStand.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_TestStand41
member.summary: (Value: 9) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the TestStand 4.1 file format. Save the file in this format to enable TestStand version 4.1 to load the file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_Current
member.summary: (Value: 1) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the current TestStand file format.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_TestStand4
member.summary: (Value: 8) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the TestStand 4.0 file format. Save the file in this format to enable TestStand version 4.0 to load the file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_TestStand42
member.summary: (Value: 10) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the TestStand 4.2 file format. Save the file in this format to enable TestStand version 4.2 to load the file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_TestStand45
member.summary: (Value: 11) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the TestStand 2010 file format. Save the file in this format to enable TestStand version 2010 to load the file. TestStand 4.5 is the internal version number for TestStand 2010.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_TestStand50
member.summary: (Value: 12) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the TestStand 2012 file format. Save the file in this format to enable TestStand version 2012 to load the file. TestStand 5.0 is the internal version number for TestStand 2012.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_TestStand_14_0
member.summary: (Value: 14) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the TestStand 2014 file format. Save the file in this format to enable TestStand version 2014 to load the file. TestStand 14.0 is the internal version number for TestStand 2014.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_TestStand51
member.summary: (Value: 13) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the TestStand 2013 file format. Save the file in this format to enable TestStand version 2013 to load the file. TestStand 5.1 is the internal version number for TestStand 2013.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_TestStand_19
member.summary: (Value: 17) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the TestStand 2019 file format. Save the file in this format to enable TestStand version 2019 to load the file. TestStand 19.0 is the internal version number for TestStand 2019.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_TestStand_16_0
member.summary: (Value: 15) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the TestStand 2016 file format. Save the file in this format to enable TestStand version 2016 to load the file. TestStand 16.0 is the internal version number for TestStand 2016.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_TestStand_17
member.summary: (Value: 16) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the TestStand 2017 file format. Save the file in this format to enable TestStand version 2017 to load the file. TestStand 17.0 is the internal version number for TestStand 2017.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_TestStand_20
member.summary: (Value: 18) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the TestStand 2020 file format. Save the file in this format to enable TestStand version 2020 to load the file. TestStand 20.0 is the internal version number for TestStand 2020.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_TestStand_21
member.summary: (Value: 19) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the TestStand 2021 file format. Save the file in this format to enable TestStand version 2021 to load the file. TestStand 21.0 is the internal version number for TestStand 2021.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WriteFileFormat.WriteFileFormat_TestStand_22
member.summary: (Value: 20) Specifies that TestStand writes out the file using the TestStand 2022 file format. Save the file in this format to enable TestStand version 2022 to load the file. TestStand 22.0 is the internal version number for TestStand 2022.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.FileVersionAutoIncrement
member.summary: Use these constants with the StationOptions.SeqFileVersionAutoIncrementOpt property to specify whether to automatically increment a component of the sequence file version when the file is saved. Versions have four components: Major, Minor, Revision and Build. TestStand displays versions using decimal points to separate the components, such as "1.2.3.4".

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.FileVersionAutoIncrement.FileVersionInc_None
member.summary: (Value: 0) Specifies that sequence file versions are not automatically incremented.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.FileVersionAutoIncrement.FileVersionInc_Major
member.summary: (Value: 1) Specifies that the major version number is incremented.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.FileVersionAutoIncrement.FileVersionInc_Revision
member.summary: (Value: 3) Specifies that the revision version number is incremented.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.FileVersionAutoIncrement.FileVersionInc_Minor
member.summary: (Value: 2) Specifies that the minor version number is incremented.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.FileVersionAutoIncrement.FileVersionInc_Build
member.summary: (Value: 4) Specifies that the build version number is incremented.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.HierarchicalExecutionFlags
member.summary: Use these constants to specify the hierarchicalExecutionFlags parameter of the Engine.NewHierarchicalExecution method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.HierarchicalExecutionFlags.HierarchicalExecMask_DontRunSetupAndCleanup
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) Specifies that a hierarchical execution does not run setup or Cleanup steps when it generates a call stack. This flag applies to the sequences that contain the Sequence Call steps you pass to the sequenceCallSteps parameter of the Engine.NewHierarchicalExecution method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.HierarchicalExecutionFlags.HierarchicalExecMask_RunRemainingSequence
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) Specifies that the execution continues normally when the call stack unwinds. When the Sequence Call steps return from the call stack the execution generates, the remaining steps execute normally in the sequences that contain the calls.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.HierarchicalExecutionFlags.HierarchicalExecMask_IgnorePreconditions
member.summary: (Value: 0x8): Specifies that when Engine.NewHierarchicalExecution creates the call stack the arguments specify, it does not check the preconditions of the Sequence Call steps that comprise the call stack.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EditNumericFormatOptions
member.summary: These constants represent the options you can use with the evaluationOptions parameter of the Engine.DisplayEditNumericFormatDialogEx method. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify more than one option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EditNumericFormatOptions.EditNumFormat_NoOptions
member.summary: (Value: 0) No options.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EditNumericFormatOptions.EditNumFormat_AllowDefaultFormat
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) Use this option to allow the user to set the numeric format to the default value in the Numeric Format dialog box.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EditNumericFormatOptions.EditNumFormat_ModalToAppMainWind
member.summary: (Value: 0x10000) By default, the dialog box is modal to the last active window of the calling thread, or if none exists, to the last active window from AppMainHwnd. If you set this option, the dialog box is modal with respect to the window handle of the Engine.AppMainHwnd property. Typically, you do not need to set this option.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlStatuses
member.summary: These constants represent the return values of the WorkspaceObject.SourceControlStatus property. Use the bitwise-AND operator with the return value to determine whether any of these flags are set.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlStatuses.SCStatus_NotInSC
member.summary: (Value: 0x0) Specifies that the file is not under source code control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlStatuses.SCStatus_InSC
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) Specifies that the file is under source code control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlStatuses.SCStatus_CheckedOut
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) Specifies that the file is checked out by you to a directory where TestStand expects the file to be. The SCStatus_CheckedOutByUser flag must also be on for this flag to be on. If SCStatus_CheckedOutByUser is on but SCStatus_CheckedOut is off, the file is checked out to a different directory.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlStatuses.SCStatus_CheckedOutOther
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) Specifies that the file is checked out by a user other than you. If this flag is on and SCStatus_CheckedOutMultiple and SCStatus_CheckedOutByUser are also on, both the current user and some other user have the file checked out. If this flag and SCStatus_CheckedOutMultiple are on but SCStatus_CheckedOutByUser is off, the current user does not have the file checked out, but several other users do.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlStatuses.SCStatus_CheckedOutMultiple
member.summary: (Value: 0x10) Specifies that the file is checked out by multiple users. The file might or might not be checked out by you.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlStatuses.SCStatus_CheckedOutByUser
member.summary: (Value: 0x1000) Specifies that the file is checked out by you independent of the directory location.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlStatuses.SCStatus_Deleted
member.summary: (Value: 0x40) Specifies that the file has been deleted from the project under source code control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SourceControlStatuses.SCStatus_OutOfDate
member.summary: (Value: 0x20) Specifies that the version you have is not the latest version of the file.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchOptions
member.summary: These constants represent the options you can use with the searchOptions parameter of the PropertyObject.Search and Engine.SearchFiles methods. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify more than one option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchOptions.SearchOptions_MatchCase
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) If this option is set, TestStand finds only those instances in which the capitalization matches the text you specify. For example, if CHR is the specified text, this option finds CHR but not Chr.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchOptions.SearchOptions_WholeWordOnly
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) If this option is set, TestStand searches for occurrences of the specified text only where the text that surrounds the occurrence is a space, punctuation mark, or other character not considered as part of a word. TestStand treats the characters A through Z, a through z, 0 through 9, and the underscore (_) as parts of a word.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchOptions.SearchOptions_RegExpr
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) If this option is set, TestStand treats certain characters in the search text as regular expression characters instead of literal characters.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchOptions.SearchOptions_IncludeSubsequenceFiles
member.summary:
(Value: 0x8) If this option is set, TestStand searches all the sequence files the Sequence Call steps specify.
Note: This option applies only to the Engine.SearchFiles method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions
member.summary: These constants represent the options you can use with the filterOptions parameter of the PropertyObject.Search and Engine.SearchFiles methods. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify more than one option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions.SearchFilterOptions_Locals
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) If this option is set, TestStand searches sequence local variables. This option applies only to the Engine.SearchFiles method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions.SearchFilterOptions_Parameters
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) If this option is set, TestStand searches sequence parameter variables. This option applies only to the Engine.SearchFiles method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions.SearchFilterOptions_FileGlobals
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) If this option is set, TestStand searches sequence file global variables. This option applies only to the Engine.SearchFiles method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions.SearchFilterOptions_Steps
member.summary: (Value: 0x8) If this option is set, TestStand searches steps. This option applies only to the Engine.SearchFiles method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions.SearchFilterOptions_CustomStepProps
member.summary: (Value: 0x10) If this option is set, TestStand searches custom step properties. You must use SearchFilterOptions_Steps in combination with this option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions.SearchFilterOptions_BuiltinStepProps
member.summary: (Value: 0x20) If this option is set, TestStand searches built-in step properties. You must use SearchFilterOptions_Steps in combination with this option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions.SearchFilterOptions_ModuleStepProps
member.summary: (Value: 0x40) If this option is set, TestStand searches module step properties. You must use SearchFilterOptions_Steps in combination with this option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions.SearchFilterOptions_StepTypes
member.summary: (Value: 0x80) If this option is set, TestStand searches step types. This option applies only to the Engine.SearchFiles method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions.SearchFilterOptions_CustomDataTypes
member.summary: (Value: 0x100) If this option is set, TestStand searches custom data types. This option applies only to the Engine.SearchFiles method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions.SearchFilterOptions_StandardDataTypes
member.summary: (Value: 0x200) If this option is set, TestStand searches standard data types. This option applies only to the Engine.SearchFiles method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions.SearchFilterOptions_BuiltinSeqAndSeqFileProps
member.summary: (Value: 0x400) If this option is set, TestStand searches built-in sequence and sequence file properties. These properties contain the settings associated with sequences and sequence files. This option applies only to the Engine.SearchFiles method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions.SearchFilterOptions_All
member.summary: (Value: 0x00ffffff) If this options is set, TestStand searches all parts of files.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchFilterOptions.SearchFilterOptions_TypesOnly
member.summary: (Value: 0x01000000) If this option is set, TestStand searches only types. You must specify which category of types to search by setting one or more of the following options: SearchFilterOptions_StepTypes, SearchFilterOptions_CustomDataTypes, or SearchFilterOptions_StandardDataTypes. This option applies only to the Engine.SearchFiles method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchElements
member.summary: These constants represent the options you can use with the elementsToSearch parameter of the PropertyObject.Search and Engine.SearchFiles methods. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify more than one option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchElements.SearchElement_Name
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) TestStand searches the property name.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchElements.SearchElement_Comment
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) TestStand searches the property comment.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchElements.SearchElement_StringValue
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) TestStand searches the value of string properties.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchElements.SearchElement_NumericValue
member.summary: (Value: 0x8) TestStand searches the value of numeric properties.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchElements.SearchElement_BooleanValue
member.summary: (Value: 0x10) TestStand searches the value of Boolean properties.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchElements.SearchElement_AllValues
member.summary: (Value: 0x1c) A combination of the following SearchElements options: SearchElement_StringValue, SearchElement_NumericValue, and SearchElement_BooleanValue.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchElements.SearchElement_All
member.summary: (Value: 0xffffffff) A combination of all the SearchElement options.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchElements.SearchElement_Attributes
member.summary: (Value: 0x20) TestStand searches through the attributes and type attributes of properties.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchElements.SearchElement_TypeName
member.summary: (Value: 0x40) TestStand searches the type name of root type instance properties. Enable this option to find all the instances of a particular type definition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchElements.SearchElement_Enumerators
member.summary: (Value: 0x80) TestStand searches the enumerators of enumeration data types.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions
member.summary: Use these constants to specify the GenerationOptions parameter of the PropertyObject.GetXML method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions.XMLOption_ExcludeEmptyObjects
member.summary: (Value: 0x8) Excludes objects without values from the generated XML.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions.XMLOption_UseValueFormatIfDefined
member.summary: (Value: 0x10) Instructs TestStand to use the formatString of each numeric object when the formatString parameter is not empty. If this flag is not set or the format string of the numeric object is empty, the PropertyObject.GetXML method uses the formatString parameter for the formatting, or "%.17g" if the formatString parameter is empty. The default for double-precision, 64-bit floating-point values is %.17g, %d for signed 64-bit integer values, and %u for unsigned 64-bit integer values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions.XMLOption_NoIndentation
member.summary: (Value: 0x20) Instructs TestStand to not automatically format the generated XML by indenting new lines with tab characters.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions.XMLOption_NoCRLF
member.summary: (Value: 0x40) Instructs TestStand to not automatically format the generated XML by adding LF or CRLF characters.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions.XMLOption_NoOptions
member.summary: (Value: 0x0) No options.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions.XMLOption_ExcludeComments
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) Excludes PropertyObject comments from the generated XML.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions.XMLOption_ExcludeFlags
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) Excludes the flag related attributes from the generated XML.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions.XMLOption_ExcludeVersionInfo
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) Excludes version information from the header of the generated XML.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions.XMLOption_UseCRLFInsteadOfLF
member.summary: (Value: 0x80) Instructs TestStand to use CRLF characters instead of adding LF characters when automatically formatting generated XML.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions.XMLOption_ExcludeAliasObjects
member.summary: (Value: 0x100) Instructs TestStand to exclude alias subproperty objects in the XML stream. By default, the PropertyObject.GetXML method includes alias subproperty objects in the XML stream.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions.XMLOption_ExcludeArrayPrototypes
member.summary: (Value: 0x200) Excludes the default prototype definition for array element properties.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions.XMLOption_ExcludeAttributes
member.summary: (Value: 0x400 | 0x800) Excludes PropertyObject attributes and type attributes from the generated XML.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.XMLOptions.XMLOption_AllowInvalidObjects
member.summary: (Value 0x1000) Pass this option to PropertyObject.GetXML to allow serialization of invalid instances of TestStand enumerator data types. Pass this option to PropertyObject.SetXML to allow deserialization of invalid instances of TestStand enumerator data types.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch
member.summary: The SearchResults object return objects of the SearchMatch class. SearchResults objects contain details about a match found as a result of a call to the PropertyObject.Search or Engine.SearchFiles methods.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch.GetLocation(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the element of the property where the match was found and the location of the match within the property when the value is coerced to a string.
member.remarks: Use the SearchMatch.MatchedText property to obtain the entire element value as a coerced string in which the match was found.
member.param: Returns the element of the property in which the match was found. The value of this parameter is one of the SearchElements constants.
Returns the zero-based index within the string of the starting character location of the match. Use the SearchMatch.MatchedText property to obtain the entire string in which the match was found.
Returns the number of characters of the text that are part of the match.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch.GetPropertyPath(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Call this method to obtain the lookup string that indicates the location of the property that contains the match.
member.remarks: If the match is from a SearchResults object that the Engine.SearchFiles method returns and the SearchMatch.TypeCategoryOfMatch property is TypeCategory_None, the SearchMatch.GetPropertyPath method returns a lookup string relative to the PropertyObjectFile.Data property. Prepend Data. to use this lookup string relative to the root of the PropertyObjectFile object.
member.param: Pass True to obtain a property path that uses property names for array indexes when possible. The name of an object element in an array is not guaranteed to be unique within the array. If you pass True for this parameter, do not use the returned property path with methods that have a lookupString parameter, such as the PropertyObject.GetPropertyObject method and the PropertyObject.Exists method.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch.MatchedText
member.summary: Returns the text string which contains the match. Use the SearchMatch.GetLocation method to determine which element of the property the string is from.
member.remarks: Use the SearchMatch.UpdateForReplace method to alter the matched text. Use the SearchMatch.UpdateForReplaceValue method to alter the value of the property in which the match was found.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch.FileDisplayName
member.summary: Returns the display name of the file in which the match was found.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch.FilePath
member.summary: Returns the absolute file path of the file in which the match was found.
member.remarks: Returns an empty string for unsaved files. Use the SearchMatch.FileDisplayName property to obtain a unique name for unsaved files.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch.FileId
member.summary: Returns the unique file ID of the file in which the match was found. This value is the same as the value the PropertyObjectFile.Id property returns.
member.remarks: ID numbers change when a file is closed and reopened. Therefore, even if a file has a different ID than what this property contains, it might be the same file. Check the SearchMatch.FilePath property against the absolute path of the file, if one is available, to determine whether the file is the same.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch.UpdateForReplace(System.String)
member.summary: Updates all the SearchMatch objects a replace operation affects. This method updates all the property paths and match locations of the current and neighboring SearchMatch objects as needed to make them consistent with the replace operation the replacementString parameter specifies.
member.remarks: This method does not perform the actual replace operation. Use PropertyObject objects to edit the file or property before calling this method.
member.param: Specifies the string with which the matched item was replaced.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch.TypeCategoryOfMatch
member.summary: Returns the TypeCategories constant that corresponds to the category of the type in which the match was found. If the match was not found in a type, this property returns TypeCategory_None.
member.remarks: This property always returns TypeCategory_None when you create the search using the PropertyObject.Search method. The value is valid only when you create the search with the Engine.SearchFiles method.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch.UserData
member.summary: Use this property to store any additional data you want to associate with the SearchMatch object. The value of this property is initially 0.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch.PropertyValueAsString
member.summary: Returns a string that describes the value of the property that contains the match. This string is equivalent to the string the PropertyObject.GetFormattedValue method returns. If the property that contains the match does not have a value, this property returns an empty string.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch.PropertyValueType
member.summary: Returns the data type of the property that contains the match.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch.UpdateForReplaceValue(System.String)
member.summary: Updates the value of the property the SearchMatch object references. This method sets the SearchMatch.MatchIsValid property to False for the current and neighboring SearchMatch objects as needed if the location of their match is the value.
member.remarks: This method does not perform the actual replace operation. Use PropertyObject objects to edit the file or property before calling this method.
member.param: Specifies the string with which the value was replaced.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchMatch.MatchIsValid
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the match is valid. When this property is False, do not call the SearchMatch.UpdateForReplace method.
member.remarks: This property is set to False when a call to the SearchMatch.UpdateForReplaceValue method invalidates or replaces the text that the match found.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchResults
member.summary: Objects in the SearchResult class are both a handle to a search in progress and a container for the results of that search. When you call the PropertyObject.Search or Engine.SearchFiles method, TestStand returns a SearchResults object. The search runs asynchronously, which means you obtain the SearchResults object before the search finishes. To wait for the search to complete, call the SearchResults.IsComplete method. Alternatively, you can access the results as they accumulate asynchronously by using the SearchResults.NumMatches property to obtain the number of matches and then accessing only the SearchMatch objects up to that number. TestStand always appends new SearchMatch objects to the end of the result list.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchResults.Cancel(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Cancels a search in progress. Calling this method after the search completes does nothing.
member.param: Pass True if you want the method to wait until the search finishes canceling before returning. Otherwise, the cancel operation is asynchronous.
Pass True if you want TestStand to process window messages while waiting for the search to complete. TestStand ignores this parameter if you do not pass True for the waitForComplete parameter.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchResults.IsComplete(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether a search is complete or waits until the search is complete.
member.param: Pass True if you want the method to wait until the search is complete before it returns.
Pass True if you want TestStand to process window messages while waiting for the search to complete. TestStand ignores this parameter if you do not pass True for the waitForComplete parameter.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchResults.NumMatches
member.summary: Returns the number of matches found up to a certain point. If the search is not yet complete, this number can continue to increase as TestStand finds new matches.
member.remarks: You can access the SearchMatch objects even as they accumulate asynchronously by using this property to obtain the number of matches and then accessing only the SearchMatch objects up to that number using the SearchResults.GetMatch method. TestStand always appends new SearchMatch objects to the end of the result list.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchResults.GetMatch(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the SearchMatch object you specify.
member.remarks: You can access the SearchMatch objects even as they accumulate asynchronously by using the SearchResults.NumMatches property to obtain the number of matches and then using this method to access only the SearchMatch objects up to that number. TestStand always appends new SearchMatch objects to the end.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the SearchMatch object you want the method to return.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchResults.NumWarnings
member.summary: Returns the number of warnings. If the search is not yet complete, this number can increase in the future as TestStand adds new warning messages. TestStand adds warning messages when it encounters an error while performing a search. A common error that can occur is when TestStand cannot load a file because of type conflicts.
member.remarks: You can access the warnings even as they accumulate asynchronously by using the SearchResults.GetWarning method to obtain the number of warnings and then using this method to access only the SearchMatch objects up to that number. TestStand always appends new warnings to the end of the result list.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchResults.GetWarning(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the warning message you specify by index.
member.remarks: You can access the warnings even as they accumulate asynchronously by using the SearchResults.NumWarnings property to obtain the number of matches and then using this method to access only the SearchMatch objects up to that number. TestStand always appends new warnings to the end of the result list.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the SearchMatch object you want the method to return.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchResults.StatusMessage
member.summary: Returns a real-time description of what the search is doing while in progress. The status message describes the file TestStand is currently loading or searching as well as other activities that relate to the search, such as building the list of files to search.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectory
member.summary: A SearchDirectory object specifies a directory in which TestStand searches for finding files. An object of this class specifies a path to an explicit directory or specifies a predefined directory, such as the TestStand directory or the Microsoft Windows directory. An object specifies any file extension restrictions and whether to search subdirectories.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectory.Type
member.summary: Several types of search directories exist. This property returns the type of search directory.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectory.Path
member.summary: Specifies the path used to find files.
member.remarks: Specifies the directory path when the value of the SearchDirectory.Type property is SearchDirectory_ExplicitDir. This property is read-only for all other directory types, and TestStand returns the path of the non-explicit directory. TestStand returns an empty string when the directory type is SearchDirectoryType_ContainingProjectDir or SearchDirectoryType_CurrentSequenceFileDir. TestStand returns an empty string if the directory type is SearchDirectoryType_CurrentWorkspaceDir when no workspace is loaded.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectory.SearchSubdirectories
member.summary: Specifies whether to include all subdirectories within the selected path in the overall search directory path.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectory.FileExtensionRestrictions
member.summary: Specifies the specific file extensions that restrict which files apply to the search directory. If the SearchDirectory.ExcludeFileExtension property is False, TestStand searches only for files in the directory with the specified extension. If the exclude parameter is True, TestStand searches only for files in the directory that does not have the specified file extensions. For example, to search only for DLLs and executable files, enter "DLL, EXE" and set the SearchDirectory.ExcludeFileExtension property to False.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectory.ExcludeFileExtension
member.summary: Set this property to False if you want TestStand to search only for files with the file extensions you specify in the SearchDirectory.FileExtensionRestrictions property. Set this property to True if you want TestStand to search only for files that do not have the file extensions specified in the SearchDirectory.FileExtensionRestrictions property.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectory.Disabled
member.summary: If you want the search directory to be included in the overall search path, set this property to False. If you set this property to True, the search directory is disabled but is included in the search directories list.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectory.ExcludeHiddenSubdirectories
member.summary: Specifies to exclude search directory subdirectories that specify the Hidden attribute in the Microsoft Windows file system. This property is False by default and has no effect unless the SearchDirectory.SearchSubdirectories property is True.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.InternalOptions
member.summary: Specifies the internal options you can access through the Engine.GetInternalOption and Engine.SetInternalOption methods.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.InternalOptions.InternalOption_WarnOnAPICallThroughDispatchInterface
member.summary: (Value: 1) Specifies a Boolean value that determines whether TestStand launches a warning dialog box for each TestStand API call you make through a dispatch interface. If you intend to use only the vtable interface for the TestStand API, use this property to determine whether the code unintentionally uses a dispatch interface to the TestStand API. The default value of this property is False. This option does not apply to the Engine object. TestStand does not warn you for calls you make through a dispatch interface to the Engine object.
member.remarks: National Instruments recommends that you only use this property for testing and debugging purposes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.InternalOptions.InternalOption_AutomationAdapterUsesDispatchForDualInterfaces
member.summary: (Value: 2) Specifies a Boolean value that determines whether the ActiveX/COM Adapter calls the dispatch portion of a dual interface instead of the vtable portion of the interface. Use this property to exercise both the vtable and dispatch portions of a dual server interface when you perform software testing on a server. The default value of this property is False.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.InternalOptions.InternalOption_UpdateExternalEnvironments
member.summary: (Value: 3) Specifies a Boolean value that determines whether TestStand installs development support items at engine start up. Development support items include TestStand palettes and toolbox items for application development environments (ADEs) that support them, such as LabVIEW and Microsoft Visual Studio. Although the TestStand installer also installs these items, this option ensures that the items are installed to an ADE if the ADE is installed or upgraded after TestStand is installed. At startup, TestStand checks whether it has already installed the support items for a particular ADE so startup time does not increase unnecessarily. If you disable this option, you can manually update the support items for a particular ADE by running the TestStand Version Selector and specifying "/ver current" on the command line or by switching to the current version in the Version Selector dialog box. The default value of the option is True. TestStand persists the setting for this option between invocations of the TestStand Engine.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.InternalOptions.InternalOption_ApplicationManager
member.summary: (Value: 5) Returns an IUnknown interface to the Application Manager user interface control for the current process. Returns a NULL interface if no Application Manager user interface control exists in the current process.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.InternalOptions.InternalOption_DisableFloatingWindowsForModalDialogs
member.summary: (Value: 10) Specifies a Boolean value that determines whether TestStand disables all windows in the same thread as the thread that launches an engine dialog box. This is useful for applications that have multiple modeless windows to disable while a modal dialog box launches. The default value of the option is True.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ModelOptions
member.summary: Use these constants with the SequenceFile.ModelOption property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ModelOptions.ModelOption_UseStationModel
member.summary: (Value: 0) Instructs TestStand to use the process model file the Station Model option on the Model tab of the Station Options dialog box specifies.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ModelOptions.ModelOption_NoModel
member.summary: (Value: 1) Specifies that the sequence file does not use a process model.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ModelOptions.ModelOption_RequireSpecificModel
member.summary: (Value: 2) Specifies a particular process model file. If you select this value, you must use the SequenceFile.ModelPath property to specify the location of the process model file.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EvalPrecondOptions
member.summary: Use these constants to specify the EvalPrecondOptions parameter of the Step.EvalPrecondForInteractiveExecution and StepType.EvalPrecondForInteractiveExecution properties.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EvalPrecondOptions.EvalPrecondOption_UseStationOption
member.summary: (Value: 0) Uses the Evaluate Preconditions in Interactive Mode option on the Execution tab of the Station Options dialog box.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EvalPrecondOptions.EvalPrecondOption_EvaluatePrecond
member.summary: (Value: 1) Evaluates the precondition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.EvalPrecondOptions.EvalPrecondOption_NoEvaluatePrecond
member.summary: (Value: 2) Does not evaluate the precondition.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WindowActivationOptions
member.summary: Use these constants as the values of the Step.WindowActivation and StepType.WindowActivation properties.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WindowActivationOptions.WinActOption_None
member.summary: (Value: 1) No activation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WindowActivationOptions.WinActOption_ActivateWhenStepCompletes
member.summary: (Value: 2) Activate when the step completes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.WindowActivationOptions.WinActOption_IfActiveReactivateWhenStepCompletes
member.summary: (Value: 3) If initially active, reactivate when the step completes.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.BatchSynchronizationOptions
member.summary: Use these constants with the Step.BatchSyncOption and StepType.BatchSyncOption properties.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.BatchSynchronizationOptions.BatchSyncOption_UseSeqFileSetting
member.summary: (Value: 0) Uses the same option the sequence file is using.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.BatchSynchronizationOptions.BatchSyncOption_UseModelSetting
member.summary: (Value: 1) Uses the same option the model is using.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.BatchSynchronizationOptions.BatchSyncOption_NoSync
member.summary: (Value: 2) No batch synchronization is used on this step.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.BatchSynchronizationOptions.BatchSyncOption_Serial
member.summary: (Value: 3) Use a Serial section to ensure that each thread in the batch executes a single step sequentially or the steps in a section sequentially and in the order you specified when you created the batch. When all threads in a batch arrive at their respective instances of a single step or an Enter step for a Serial section, TestStand releases one thread at a time in ascending order according to the order number you assign to threads when you added them to the batch using the Batch Specification step type. As each thread executes the single step or reaches the Exit step for the section, the next thread in the batch executes the single step or proceeds from the Enter step. After all threads in the batch execute the single step or arrive at the Exit step, they continue and exit the section together.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.BatchSynchronizationOptions.BatchSyncOption_Parallel
member.summary: (Value: 4) When all threads in the batch arrive at their respective instances of a single step or an Enter step for a Parallel section, TestStand releases all the threads at once. Each thread blocks after executing the single step or after reaching the Exit step for the section until all threads can continue and exit the section together.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.BatchSynchronizationOptions.BatchSyncOption_OneThreadOnly
member.summary: (Value: 5) Use a One Thread Only section to specify that only one thread in the batch executes the single step or the steps in the section. Typically, you use this type of section to perform an operation that applies to the batch as a whole, such as raising the temperature in a test chamber. When all threads in a batch arrive at their respective instances of the single step or an Enter step for a One Thread Only section, TestStand releases only the thread with the lowest order number. When that thread executes the single step or arrives at the Exit step for the section, all remaining threads in the batch skip the single step or jump from the Enter step to the Exit step, skipping steps within the section. The threads in the batch then continue and exit the section together.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.CustomPostStepUIMsgOptions
member.summary: These constants represent the values you can use with the CustomUIMessageOptions parameter of the Execution.AddPostStepCustomUIMessage method. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify more than one option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.CustomPostStepUIMsgOptions.CustomUIMsgOptions_SuppressIfTraceSent
member.summary: (Value: 1) When this flag is set, TestStand does not send a user interface message if a UIMsg_Trace message is sent. Do not use this option if you want the UIMessage sent even when tracing is disabled.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.CustomPostStepUIMsgOptions.CustomUIMsgOptions_AppliesToAllThreads
member.summary: (Value: 2) Use this flag to send custom user interface message to all threads this execution creates. Otherwise, only the foreground thread of the execution sends this message.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.TimeLimitActions.TimeLimitAction_Terminate

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectories
member.summary: This collection class contains elements using the SearchDirectory type. The collection specifies the directories TestStand searches for finding files. The directories listed first in the collection take precedence over those listed later in the collection. When you run TestStand for the first time, the collection contains a default set of search directory paths.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectories.Item(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a reference to an item at the specified index in the collection.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the item to retrieve.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectories.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of items in the collection.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectories.Insert(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new item to the collection.
member.remarks: A search directory is a search path for finding files.
member.param: Specifies the path used to find files.

TestStand maintains an internal list of search directories in which the lower index paths take precedence over the higher index paths. The index parameter specifies the index where the new search directory must be inserted. If you pass a value of -1, the new directory is inserted at the end of the list.
Specifies whether to include all subdirectories within the selected path in the overall search path.

Specifies the specific file extensions that restrict which files apply to the search directory. If the exclude parameter is False, TestStand searches in the directories only for files with the specified extensions. If the exclude parameter is True, TestStand searches in the directories for files that do not have the specified file extensions. For example, to search for only DLLs and executable files, pass "DLL,EXE" for this parameter and False for the exclude parameter.

If you pass False, TestStand searches only for files with the specific file extensions specified in the fileExtRestrict parameter. If you pass True, TestStand searches for files without the specific extension.
Set this parameter to False if you want the search directory to be included in the overall search path. This setting allows the user to disable the search directory without deleting it from the list.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectories.Remove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the specified item from this collection, if it exists.
member.remarks: You cannot delete predefined search directories.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the item to remove.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectories.MoveSearchDirectory(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves a search directory within the collection.
member.remarks: TestStand maintains an internal list of search directories in which the lower index paths take precedence over the higher index paths.
member.param: Specifies a zero-based index indicating the new position of the search directory to move.
Specifies a zero-based index indicating the new position of the search directory to move.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.SearchDirectories.Reload
member.summary: Instructs TestStand to discard the current search directory list and reload the list from disk.

remarks.para: Note: TestStand immediately updates the TestExec.ini configuration file when you make changes to the search directories programmatically or by using a user interface. Use the SearchDirectories.Reload method to update the search directories after an external application, such as a source code control application, modifies the TestExec.ini configuration file.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ExternalReportViewer
member.summary: An ExternalReportViewer represents relationships between a specific report format and the application used to open it. TestStand keeps a list of report viewers. If you do not specify an external viewer for a format, the file opens in the application Microsoft Windows associates with the file extension of the report file.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ExternalReportViewer.Format
member.summary: Specifies the report format for the external report viewer to display. For example, txt for text files or HTML for HTML files.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ExternalReportViewer.Arguments
member.summary: Specifies optional arguments that indicate to the external viewer which file to open and how to open it. For example, "%filename" indicates to the external viewer the name of the file to open.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ExternalReportViewer.Path
member.summary: Specifies the filename the external report viewer executes.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ExternalReportViewer.AutoLaunch
member.summary: Specifies the external report viewer to launch automatically when the report is generated. Set this property to True to automatically launch the external report viewer and show the report.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.API.ExternalReportViewers
member.summary: Collection that contains elements using the ExternalReportViewer type. Represents the list of external report viewers used to open the different report file types TestStand supports.

member.summary: Adds a new external report viewer to the collection.
member.param: When you specify an external report viewer, you must indicate the external report viewer name and the report format, such as Microsoft Notepad (txt) or Google Chrome (html).
Specifies the name for the external report viewer to launch.
Specifies the optional command-line arguments required to launch the external report viewer.
Specifies the external report viewer to automatically launch when the report is generated. Pass True to automatically launch the external report viewer and show the report.
